intro: Tetraena hamiensis, commonly known as the Hami tetraena, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Xinjiang, China. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to its resilience, it plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
